description: mounted on stiff paper; St. Jerome, with long curly white hair and long beard, crawling out of a cave; baskets in a lean-to to right of cave; lion in foreground, LRQ; lush landscape scene with large tree at left; inscription at bottom
inscription:
Signature, Date and Inscription

LRC, in black: [P.H.]
medium: Pen and brown ink on vellum
provenance: "P.H." Lugt 2084, unidentified collection. Sir Bruce Ingram, Lugt 1405a, Chesham, England (until d. 1963; bequeathed to Winter); Carl Winter, Lugt 4782, Cambridge, England (1963-d. 1966). [Alister Mathews, Bournemouth, England]. A. Caselli (in 1968). Esther and Malcolm Bick, Longmeadow, Massachusetts (until 1977, sale, Sotheby's, London, December 5, 1977, no. 56, for Â£385, to Moir); Alfred Moir, Santa Barbara (1977-d. 2010; bequeathed to MIA)
signed: LLC, in brown ink: [Franc. Grigiotte (?), fece di / Decemb. 1623 in Ro.a]
title: Saint Jerome in the Wilderness
